required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Corona Vaccination on AMH- Anti Mullerian Hormone
clinical_study.official_title: Wether Corona Vaccination Has Negative Impact on AMH- Anti Mullerian Hormone Which Express Ovarin Function

brief_summary.textblock:
Since December 2020 Nationwide anti-COVID-19 vaccination began in Israel using the Pfizer - BioNtech vaccine (BNT162b2 mRNA). The vaccination campaign has been associated with concerns regarding potential detrimental effects on future fertility. The aim of the study is to determine the impact of COVID-19 vaccination on n AMH- Anti Mullerian Hormone which express ovarin function.
disease and/or immunization on human follicular function, by comparing follicular steroidogenesis, response to the LH/hCG trigger, and oocyte quality biomarker (HSPG2), in the aspirated follicular fluid of patients undergoing ovum pick-up.

detailed_description.textblock: Our assumption is that there is no effect of the vaccination on the AMH level. We plan to recruit 90 patients who are divided to three groups First group patients who vaccinated and measure the AMH before and up to 9 months after vaccination. Second group patients who were infected by Covid-19 ant therefor were not vaccinated to compare the AMH level before and after the infectious. The third group patients who were not infected and not vaccinated.

arm_group.description: First group patients who vaccinated and measure the AMH before and up to 9 months after vaccination.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Infected patients by covid-19 and not vacinated
arm_group.description: Second group patients who were infected by Covid-19 ant therefor were not vaccinated
Ptients who who were not infected nor vacinated by Covid-19.

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood samples evaluated for Anti Mullarin Hormone (AMH)

study_pop.textblock: Women who are going through IVF treatments.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18-44
Exclusion Criteria:
Age over 45
